item.title: Highguard Developer Was Backed By Tencent
item.content:encoded:
As Highguard’s struggles continue amid collapsing player counts and layoffs at developer Wildlight Entertainment, a new report has shed light on who was funding the game all these years.

According to Stephen Totilo of Game File, Chinese conglomerate Tencent was the “lead financial backer” of the studio. Specifically, it’s said that TiMi Studio Group is the main studio backing the game.

Up until now, the funders behind the game have been kept quiet. In past interviews, the studio has declined to comment on who was investing in the studio.

Totilo adds that neither Tencent nor Wildlight provided a comment on the matter by the time of publication. Insider Gaming has also reached out for comment, but has not received a response.

Highguard launched on January 26th to nearly 100,000 concurrent players on Steam. Since then the game has seen its playerbase fall to under 2,000 peak concurrents on the platform. It has also received mixed reviews.

What do you think of Tencent financially backing Highguard? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming, read about Clickup Media laying off its editorial staff and pivoting to AI content. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

More from Mike Straw

item.title: PIONER Rolls Out Premium Subscription Plan for Devoted Players
item.content:encoded:
PIONER, the post-apocalyptic MMORPG with a vibe similar to STALKER and Fallout 76, has today introduced a new PIONER Extra subscription service. This service is entirely optional but allows the game’s most dedicated players to enhance their experience with a few key bonuses.

For instance, it unlocks unlimited stash storage, allowing players to store as much as they want, without any restrictions. In a game where loot is plentiful, this is admittedly quite handy.

In a post on Steam, GFA Games revealed that PIONER, the post-apocalyptic, PvPvE MMO, has a new subscription service, running for now at a ‘standard tier’ that will be upgraded in time.

Per the post, the PIONER Extra service includes:

  • Premium Currency Bonus: Every subscription period comes with an in-game currency reward, so you’re getting value back right away.
  • Mobile Stash: Deploy a portable storage unit anywhere on the map. Other players on your server can use it too. It operates on a cooldown, and you’ll get a HUD notification the moment it’s ready again.
  • Mobile Repair Station: Drop a repair bench out in the field to fix your gear on the go. Same cooldown system, same shared access for nearby players, same notification when it recharges.
  • Unlimited Stash Storage: No more worrying about running out of space. While your subscription is active, your stash has infinite slots.
  • Exclusive Cosmetic Item: Subscribers receive a unique role-play item to stand out in the world.

The team at GFA advised that you subscribe and play, and when your purchased time expires, you can simply renew for as long as you’d like. There’s a new tier coming soon, with ‘even more features’, but we don’t know yet what that will look like.

There are some stark similarities here between PIONER Extra and Fallout 1st, the premium subscription service that runs in Fallout 76 and gives users many of the same benefits.

PIONER Extra costs as little as $4.92 a month when you commit to a 360-day subscription, or as much as $6.99 a month for a rolling, once-monthly subscription.

Are you interested in PIONER? Let us know what you think about PIONER Extra on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Highguard’s website is down

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#983)—Answers for Wednesday, February 18
item.content:encoded:
We’re midway through another week and grinding hard for that weekend. Today? We start as we always do, with an NYT Connections puzzle. If you’ve just woken up or are halfway through your day and hitting today’s challenge, be sure to scroll down and check out today’s NYT Connections hints and answers.

I’ve got the best NYT Connections solutions you’re looking for today.

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing lineup of the New York Times titles. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 18)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • HEAVY
  • CRESTED
  • BAD
  • FEATHER
  • FLY
  • TEASE
  • BANTAM
  • TOPICAL
  • CURL
  • SOUR
  • WICKED
  • LEGHORN
  • SHAVING
  • CRIMP
  • FREE-RANGE
  • RAD

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words you might associate with hair design
  • Green – Words you might have used to describe something cool back in the day
  • Blue – Words you might use to label a chicken
  • Purple – Words associated with cream of all kinds

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 18:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 18 (#983)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – CRIMP, CURL, FEATHER, TEASE
  • Green – BAD, FLY, RAD, WICKED
  • Blue – BANTAM, CRESTED, FREE-RANGE, LEGHORN
  • Purple – HEAVY, SHAVING, SOUR, TOPICAL)

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…
